| Frequent Parent-Child Relationships for DR, ES, H | Frequent Parent-Child Relationships for ‘hearing’ # For this page, frequent is defined as (1) the parent task type occurred at least 100 times and (2) either the parent-child relationship occurred at least 500 times (Count column) or among all parent-child relationships with the same parent task type, at least 40% had the specific child task type (Percent column) Here is a diagram of the frequent parent-child relationships:

| Frequent TCSs for DR, ES, H | Frequent TCSs for ‘hearing’ Docket # A Task Creation Sequence (TCS) is the sequence of task types for an appeal, sorted by creation time. This page shows TCSs that satisfy either: the TCS occurred at least 1500 times or the TCS is in the top 15 frequent TCSs The TCSs below are grouped by appeals that exemplify the TCSs. | All Roles | Attorney | Judge | Colocated | Acting Judge | Dispatch User | Regional Office User | Intake User | Hearings User | Acting Judge Description # In Queue the Acting Judge role is for users performing the duties of an AVLJ within the Veteran appeals process. The Acting Judge role is similar to the judge role, however they are limited by: Lack of a Judge Team

| All Roles | Attorney | Judge | Colocated | Acting Judge | Dispatch User | Regional Office User | Intake User | Hearings User | Attorney Description # The attorney role is responsible for performing the duties of an Attorney in the Veteran appeals process. Tasks # The attorney role will have an Attorney Task assigned to them based on a parent Judge Assign Task or Judge Decision Review Task when a Judge assigns them a case.

| All Roles | Attorney | Judge | Colocated | Acting Judge | Dispatch User | Regional Office User | Intake User | Hearings User | Colocated Description # The Colocated user role is any user of the Caseflow application performing the duties of a VSJ support staff in the Veteran appeals process (see Colocated). Users with this role can complete various tasks in the appeals process to support the attorneys and judges with moving the appeal through its different phases.

| All Roles | Attorney | Judge | Colocated | Acting Judge | Dispatch User | Regional Office User | Intake User | Hearings User | Dispatch User Description # Dispatch users are any user of Caseflow that is involved with the dispatch phase. This group can also include Judges as well as Attorneys. Tasks # Bva Dispatch Task (Organization) Bva Dispatch Task (User) Judge Dispatch Return Task almost only in DR and ES dockets Attorney Dispatch Return Task only in DR and ES dockets

| All Roles | Attorney | Judge | Colocated | Acting Judge | Dispatch User | Regional Office User | Intake User | Hearings User | Hearings User Description # Hearings users encompass any users of the caseflow application that are involved with scheduling and managing hearings within the Veteran appeals process. This can include Acting Judge, Attorney, Judge, and Colocated users. Additionally, there are 2 users specific to the hearings phase:

| All Roles | Attorney | Judge | Colocated | Acting Judge | Dispatch User | Regional Office User | Intake User | Hearings User | Intake User Description # Intake users encompass any user of Caseflow that can perform intake tasks within the Veteran appeals process. Tasks # NOTE: Intake users do not have any assigned tasks within Caseflow as a case is not “in” caseflow until a user has completed intake.

| All Roles | Attorney | Judge | Colocated | Acting Judge | Dispatch User | Regional Office User | Intake User | Hearings User | Judge Description # The Judge role is for users of the Caseflow application performing the duties of a Judge in the Veteran appeals process. The Judge is primarily responsible for assigning tasks to attorneys as well as reviewing appeals decisions. Other responsibilities of the judge role include hearing related tasks including the Schedule Hearing and the Hearing Clarification tasks.

| All Roles | Attorney | Judge | Colocated | Acting Judge | Dispatch User | Regional Office User | Intake User | Hearings User | Regional Office User Description # Regional Office Users (RO) are any Caseflow user that is working at a VA regional office. This group can also include VSO representatives. VSO Employees are users who work at a participating Veterans Service Organization (VSO) or a representative of that organization.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | AssignHearingDispositionTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. After the hearing is addressed in some way, users assign a disposition to the hearing (held, cancelled, no show, postponed), which creates child task(s). Once those child task(s) are completed, the AssignHearingDispositionTask will be completed. Different task structures result based on the hearing’s disposition.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | AttorneyDispatchReturnTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. See parent JudgeDispatchReturnTask_User. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: Expected parent task: JudgeDispatchReturnTask

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | AttorneyQualityReviewTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. See parent JudgeQualityReviewTask_User. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: Expected parent task: JudgeQualityReviewTask
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | AttorneyRewriteTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | AttorneyTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: Task tracking work done by attorneys at BVA. Attorneys are assigned tasks by judges. Attorney tasks include: writing draft decisions for judges adding admin actions (like translating documents)

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | BoardGrantEffectuationTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: A task to track when the Board grants a benefit that is not compensation or pension, like education or a loan guaranty, otherwise known as an “effectuation task”. This task is created for the appropriate business lines based on the benefit types of the decision issues.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | BvaDispatchTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: Task assigned to BVA Dispatch team members whenever a judge completes a case review. This indicates that an appeal is decided and the appellant is about to be notified of the decision.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | BvaDispatchTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. See parent BvaDispatchTask_Organization.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | CavcCorrespondenceMailTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: Task created by the mail team when mail arrives for a CAVC Appeal which is in processing with the CAVC Litigation Support team. May or not end up being related to CAVC response.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | CavcCorrespondenceMailTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | CavcRemandProcessedLetterResponseWindowTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: Task to indicate that Litigation Support is awaiting a response from the appellant, after sending the CAVC-remand-processed letter to an appellant (SendCavcRemandProcessedLetterTask). This task is for CAVC Remand appeal streams. The appeal is put on hold for 90 days, with the option of ending the hold early.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | CavcRemandProcessedLetterResponseWindowTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | CavcTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: This task is used to track all related CAVC subtasks for AMA Appeal Streams. If this task is still open, there is still more CAVC-specific work to be done of this appeal.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | ChangeHearingDispositionTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: Task automatically assigned to the Hearing Admin organization and/or a member of that team when a disposition has not been set on a hearing that was held more than 48 hours ago. Note that if NoShowHearingTask or TranscriptionTask are created in error, a coordinator can create a ChangeHearingDispositionTask.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | ChangeHearingDispositionTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | ChangeHearingRequestTypeTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: Task created when a hearing coordinator visits the Case Details page of an appeal with a Travel Board hearing request. Gives the user the option to convert that request to a video or virtual hearing request so it can be scheduled in Caseflow.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | DistributionTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: A DistributionTask is created after the intake process is completed on an AMA case. This task signals that an appeal is ready for distribution to a judge, including for auto case distribution.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | DistributionTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | DocketSwitchMailTask_Organization Description # Unique compared to other MailTasks in that it gets assigned to the user that created it. This task is used to begin the process of switching an appeal’s docket. Upon completion of this task by the Clerk of the Board, a DocketSwitchRulingTask gets created and assigned to a VLJ to rule on the request

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | EvidenceSubmissionWindowTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: Task that signals that a case now has a 90-day window for appellant to submit additional evidence before their appeal is decided (established by AMA). These tasks serve to block distribution until the evidence submission window is up.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | EvidenceSubmissionWindowTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | FoiaTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: Task to track when a Freedom of Information Act task has been assigned to Privacy Team
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | FoiaTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. See parent FoiaTask_Organization.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | HearingRelatedMailTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | HearingTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: A task used to track all related hearing subtasks. A hearing task is associated with a hearing record in Caseflow and might have several child tasks to resolve in order to schedule a hearing, hold it, and mark the disposition.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | IhpColocatedTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. InformalHearingPresentationTasks are created when IHP tasks is automatically created by Caseflow (and assigned to a specific VSO), while IhpColocatedTasks are created (and assigned to the Colocated team) when manually created by a user.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | IhpColocatedTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | InformalHearingPresentationTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: Task assigned to VSOs to submit an Informal Hearing Presentation for Veterans who have elected not to have a hearing. IHPs are a chance for VSOs to make final arguments before a case is sent to the Board.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | InformalHearingPresentationTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. See parent InformalHearingPresentationTask_Organization.
InformalHearingPresentationTask_Vso Description # Deprecated – see InformalHearingPresentationTask_Organization. Related tickets: https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/caseflow/pull/7768
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | JudgeAddressMotionToVacateTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | JudgeAssignTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: Task assigned to judge from which they will assign the associated appeal to one of their attorneys by creating a task (an AttorneyTask but not any of its subclasses) to draft a decision on the appeal.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | JudgeDecisionReviewTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: Task for a judge to review decisions. A JudgeDecisionReviewTask implies that there is a decision that needs to be reviewed from an attorney. The case associated with this task appears in the judge’s Cases to review view There should only ever be one open JudgeDecisionReviewTask at a time for an appeal.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | JudgeDispatchReturnTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: Task to complete a case or assign it to an attorney after it’s returned to the judge by the dispatch team. See parent BvaDispatchTask_User.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | JudgeQualityReviewTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: Task to complete a case or assign it to an attorney after it’s returned to the judge by the quality review team. See parent QualityReviewTask_User.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | MailTask_Organization Description # The parent class to all mail tasks. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: Task to track when the mail team receives any appeal-related mail from an appellant. Mail is processed by a mail team member, and then a corresponding task is then assigned to an organization. Tasks are assigned to organizations, including VLJ Support, AOD team, Privacy team, and Lit Support, and include: add Evidence or Argument changing Power of Attorney advance a case on docket (AOD) withdrawing an appeal switching dockets add post-decision motions Adding a mail task to an appeal is done by mail team members and will create a task assigned to the mail team.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | MandateHoldTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: Task to indicate that CAVC Litigation Support is waiting on a mandate from the Board for a CAVC remand of type straight_reversal or death_dismissal. The appeal is being remanded, but CAVC has not returned the mandate to the Board yet.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | MdrTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: Task to indicate that CAVC Litigation Support is working on a Memorandum Decision on Remand (MDR), i.e., the appeal is being remanded, but CAVC has not returned the mandate to the Board yet.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | MissingHearingTranscriptsColocatedTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | MissingRecordsColocatedTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | MissingRecordsColocatedTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | NewRepArgumentsColocatedTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | NewRepArgumentsColocatedTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | NoShowHearingTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Task created after an appellant no-shows for a hearing. Gives the hearings team the options to decide how to handle the no-show hearing after the judge indicates that the appellant no-showed. See HearingTask for Hearing dispositions flows, esp. the “No show” flow.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | NoShowHearingTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. See NoShowHearingTask_Organization.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | OtherColocatedTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | OtherColocatedTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | OtherMotionMailTask_Organization Description # A subclass of MailTask_Organization Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | OtherMotionMailTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | PendingScanningVbmsColocatedTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | PendingScanningVbmsColocatedTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | PoaClarificationColocatedTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | PoaClarificationColocatedTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | PowerOfAttorneyRelatedMailTask_Organization Description # A subclass of MailTask_Organization Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | PowerOfAttorneyRelatedMailTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | PreRoutingFoiaColocatedTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | PreRoutingFoiaColocatedTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | PreRoutingMissingHearingTranscriptsColocatedTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | PreRoutingMissingHearingTranscriptsColocatedTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | PreRoutingTranslationColocatedTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | PreRoutingTranslationColocatedTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | PrivacyActRequestMailTask_Organization Description # A subclass of MailTask_Organization Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | PrivacyActRequestMailTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | PrivacyActTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: Task to track when an appeal has been assigned to Privacy Team
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | PrivacyActTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. See PrivacyActTask_Organization.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | PrivacyComplaintMailTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | PrivacyComplaintMailTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | PulacCerulloTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | PulacCerulloTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. See parent PulacCerulloTask_Organization.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | QualityReviewTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: Task to track when an appeal has been randomly selected to be quality reviewed by the Quality Review team.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | QualityReviewTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. See QualityReviewTask_Organization.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | ReconsiderationMotionMailTask_Organization Description # A subclass of MailTask_Organization Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | ReconsiderationMotionMailTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | RetiredVljColocatedTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | RetiredVljColocatedTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | ReturnedUndeliverableCorrespondenceMailTask_Organization Description # A subclass of MailTask_Organization Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | ReturnedUndeliverableCorrespondenceMailTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | RootTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: Caseflow Intake establishes the appeal. Once the appeal is established, Caseflow Queue automatically creates a Root Task for other tasks to attach to, depending on the Veteran’s situation. Root task that tracks an appeal all the way through the appeal lifecycle.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | RootTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | ScheduleHearingColocatedTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: This task is used to either confirm that a hearing has been scheduled or create a ScheduleHearingTask indicating that a hearing needs to be scheduled.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | ScheduleHearingColocatedTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | ScheduleHearingTask_Organization Description # At the end of Intake, if the Veteran chose the Hearing docket, this task with a HearingTask parent is created. Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: Task to schedule a hearing for a veteran making a claim. When this task is created, HearingTask is created as the parent task in the appeal tree.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | ScheduleHearingTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | SendCavcRemandProcessedLetterTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: Task for Litigation Support to take necessary action before sending the CAVC-remand-processed letter to an appellant. This task is for CAVC Remand appeal streams. If this task is assigned to an org (i.e., CavcLitigationSupport), then: Expected parent: CavcTask Expected assigned_to: CavcLitigationSupport If this task is assigned to a user (i.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | SendCavcRemandProcessedLetterTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | SpecialCaseMovementTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: Task to record on the appeal that the special case movement manually assigned the case outside of automatic case distribution
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | StatusInquiryMailTask_Organization Description # A subclass of MailTask_Organization Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | StatusInquiryMailTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | StayedAppealColocatedTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | StayedAppealColocatedTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | Task_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Base model for all tasks in generic organizational task queues in Caseflow Tasks represent work to be done by judges, attorneys, VSOs, and anyone else who touches a Veteran’s appeal. Supports common actions like: marking tasks complete assigning a task to a team assigning a task to an individual
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | Task_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. See Task_Organization.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | TimedHoldTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: Task that places parent task on hold for specified length of time. Holds expire through the TaskTimerJob. https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/caseflow/wiki/Timed-Tasks#timedholdtask TimedHoldTask_Organization is used only for appeals in the Hearing docket – see All Tasks. See TimedHoldTask_User, which is used for all dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | TimedHoldTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Timed Tasks See related TimedHoldTask_Organization.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | TrackVeteranTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: Task created for appellant representatives to track appeals that have been received by the Board. After the appeal is established, if the Veteran has a representative, a Track Veteran Task is automatically created and assigned to that representative so they can see their appeals.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | TrackVeteranTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | TranscriptionTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. See Transcription / Evidence Submission. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: Task to either confirm the completion of the hearing transcription or reschedule the hearing. If there’s a problem with the hearing recording, the veteran/appellant is usually notified.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | TranscriptionTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | TranslationColocatedTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | TranslationTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: After intake, a TranslationTask is automatically assigned to the Translation organization when a case originates from an RO in Puerto Rico or the Philippines because the VA assumes there are Veteran documents needing translation. Task can be manually assigned in other stages.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | TranslationTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. See TranslationTask_Organization.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | UnaccreditedRepColocatedTask_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | UnaccreditedRepColocatedTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | VacateMotionMailTask_Organization Description # A subclass of MailTask_Organization Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.
| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | VacateMotionMailTask_User Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets.

| Tasks Overview | All Tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | VeteranRecordRequest_Organization Description # Task stats for DR, for ES, for H dockets. Code comments extracted from Ruby file: Created whenever an Appeal request issue has a benefit_type that is not compensation or pension.

item.title: Roles Overview
item.description: | All Roles | Attorney | Judge | Colocated | Acting Judge | Dispatch User | Regional Office User | Intake User | Hearings User | Roles Overview # There are a number of different roles available within Caseflow defined primarily by which functions they are allowed to perform. Attorney Judge Colocated Acting Judge Dispatch User Regional Office User Intake User Hearings User Users with a particular role will have access to perform different actions on tasks that have been assigned to them in their queue.

item.title: Tasks Overview
item.description: | README | All tasks | DR tasks | ES tasks | H tasks | See How to use for a description of the docket types: Direct Review (DR), Evidence Submission (ES), and Hearing (H). Appeals Process: mural Tasks Overview # The tasks presented on this page are organized into phases of the appeal process: Regional Office Phase Intake Phase Hearing Phase Decision Phase Quality Review Phase Dispatch Phase How to interpret bullets and subbullets in “Associated tasks” sections:
